Alcor and Mizar
25 second exposure of the blue stars Alcor (bottom) and Mizar (top). One can tell that Mizar is at least 2 stars. It is actually at least 4 stars. Alcor and…
objects.photodata:
Creator JCP

Title Alcor and Mizar

Description 25 second exposure of the blue stars Alcor (bottom) and Mizar (top). One can tell that Mizar is at least 2 stars. It is actually at least 4 stars. Alcor and Mizar are a visual double in the handle of the Big Dipper asterism.

Original Date 4/14/20, 10:41 PM

Make Canon

Camera Canon EOS REBEL T5i

Focal Length 0 mm

Metering Mode Center weighted average

ISO Equivalent 6400

Exposure Time 25.0s

Aperture ƒ/∞

Exposure bias 0 EV

Exposure Program Manual control

White balance Manual white balance

Flash Flash did not fire

Resolution 1920 x 2880

objects.thumbCaption:
Eta Cassiopeiae
Eta Cassiopeiae is a double star in the constellation Cassiopeia with a separation of 12 arcseconds. This binary star system is about 20 lightyears away from…
objects.photodata:
Title Eta Cassiopeiae

Description Eta Cassiopeiae is a double star in the constellation Cassiopeia with a separation of 12 arcseconds. This binary star system is about 20 lightyears away from us. The brighter, yellower star is much like our Sun, while the slightly redder star is a bit less massive.

Original Date 3/25/19, 8:03 PM

Make Canon

Camera Canon EOS REBEL T5i

Focal Length 0 mm

Metering Mode Center weighted average

ISO Equivalent 800

Exposure Time 10.0s

Aperture ƒ/∞

Exposure bias 0 EV

Exposure Program Manual control

White balance Manual white balance

Flash Flash did not fire

Resolution 1920 x 1280

objects.photodata:
Creator JCP

Title Procyon - a bright star.

Description The star Procyon in Canis Minor. One of the brightest stars in the winter sky, but outshined by nearby Sirius in Canis Major. Stacked exposure taken with the SVbony 305 pro guide camera.

Make SVbony

Camera 305 Pro
objects.title: Procyon - a bright star.
objects.imageCaption:
Procyon - a bright star.
The star Procyon in Canis Minor. One of the brightest stars in the winter sky, but outshined by nearby Sirius in Canis Major. Stacked exposure taken with the SVbony 305 pro guide camera.
objects.name: Procyon_00001_WithDisplayStretch_sW.jpg
objects.comment: The star Procyon in Canis Minor.  One of the brightest stars in the winter sky, but outshined by nearby Sirius in Canis Major.  Stacked exposure taken with the SVbony 305 pro guide camera.
